result.execSummary:
The defendant Chadwick S Tompkins was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Repeater], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Detainer cancellation.

Defendant Chadwick S Tompkins in court, in custody, with attorney M. Elizabeth Weathers.   Kristi J Gordon appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant appeared by video.
The Defendant was sentenced as follows:
Count #1:
JAIL: 30 DAYS (Consecutive to current sentence).
COSTS: $243.00 (to be converted to civil judgment).
DNA SURCHARGE: $200.00 (to be converted to a civil judgment). 
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
Detainer Acknowledgement from Kettle Moraine Correctional.
Sentencing hearing on May 23, 2016 at 02:45 pm.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Chadwick S Tompkins in court, in custody, with attorney M. Elizabeth Weathers.   Brian J. Juech appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 1.  Court finds defendant guilty.  Count #2 is dismissed and read in. The Court sets the matter for a sentencing date in about 30 days to allow for victim notification.   The Defendant to appear by video for the hearing.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for May 23, 2016 at 02:45 pm.

From Waukesha Sheriff, no cost.
Defendant not in custody.
